decision_conditions: The proposed side extension and loft conversion including the hip to gable roof conversion and semi-gabled end would unbalance the appearance of this pair of semi-detached bungalows and appear as an unacceptably dominant and visually intrusive feature in the street scene and rear garden harmful to the appearance of the surrounding area, contrary to Policy DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document, the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document and Policy 7.4 of the London Plan.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent Paul Robinson via email on 31/07/20.
description: Conversion of roof space to habitable use involving conversion of roof from hip to gable end. Single storey side extension involving demolition of existing garage and changes to rear elevation involving demolition of conservatory.
